intro: Polyxena pusilla, commonly known as the small polyxena, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and clustered in loose inflorescences. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic foliage.
